intro: Cinchona gammiana, commonly known as the yellow quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and yellow flowers. The plant is notable for its production of quinine, a compound historically used in the treatment of malaria. Cinchona gammiana typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its bark contains alkaloids that have both medicinal and commercial significance.
